item.title: A Field Guide to Lies & Stats (Levitin 2016)
item.description: Evaluating Numbers Plausibility Numerical sense checks. Claim: “In the 35 years since marijuana laws stopped being enforced in California, the number of marijuana smokers has doubled every year”. Even if we start with the most generous estimate that intitially there was 1 marijuana smoker then after 35 years that would give us \(2^{34} (> 17\text{bil})\) smokers. Non mutually exclusive surveys. “7 out of 10 dentists recommend colgate”. They also recommend plenty of other brands.

item.description: Critique of Traditional Economics E.g.
